parameters.name: sysparm_display_value
parameters.description:
Data retrieval operation for reference and choice fields.

Based on this value, retrieves the display value and/or the actual value from the database.

"true" returns display values for all fields.
"false" returns actual values from the database.  If a value is not specified, this parameter defaults to false.
"all" returns both actual and display values.

parameters.name: sysparm_query
parameters.description:
Encoded query used to filter the result set. The encoded query supports order by. To sort responses based on certain fields, use the ORDERBY and ORDERBYDESC clauses in sysparm_query. For example, sysparm_query=active=true^ORDERBYnumber^ORDERBYDESCcategory filters all active records and orders the results in ascending order by number first, and then in descending order by category.

If part of the query is invalid, such as by specifying an invalid field name, the instance ignores the invalid part. It then returns rows using only the valid portion of the query. You can control this behavior using the property glide.invalid_query.returns_no_rows. Set this property to true to return no rows on an invalid query.

parameters.name: sysparm_view
parameters.description: UI view to determine fields returned in the response.

parameters.name: sysparm_limit
parameters.description: Limit to be applied on pagination. The default is 10,000.

parameters.name: sysparm_offset
parameters.description: Number of records to exclude from the query. Use this parameter to obtain more records than specified in sysparm_limit. For example, if sysparm_limit is set to 500, but there are additional records you want to query, specify a sysparm_offset value of 500 to get the second set of records. Do not pass a negative number in the sysparm_offset parameter.

parameters.name: sysparm_exclude_reference_link
parameters.description: Additional information provided for reference fields, such as the URI to the reference resource, is suppressed.

parameters.name: sysparm_suppress_pagination_header
parameters.description: Set this value to true to remove the Link header from the response. The Link header enables you to request additional pages of data when the number of records matching your query exceeds the query limit.

parameters.name: sysparm_offset
parameters.description: Number of records to exclude from the query. Use this parameter to obtain more records than specified in sysparm_limit. For example, if sysparm_limit is set to 500, but there are additional records you want to query, specify a sysparm_offset value of 500 to get the second set of records. Do not pass a negative number in the sysparm_offset parameter.

parameters.name: sysparm_exclude_reference_link
parameters.description: Additional information provided for reference fields, such as the URI to the reference resource, is suppressed.

parameters.name: sysparm_suppress_pagination_header
parameters.description: Set this value to true to remove the Link header from the response. The Link header enables you to request additional pages of data when the number of records matching your query exceeds the query limit.

parameters.name: sys_id
parameters.description: The sys_id of the change request to load.

parameters.name: sysparm_display_value
parameters.description:
Data retrieval operation for reference and choice fields.

Based on this value, retrieves the display value and/or the actual value from the database.

"true" returns display values for all fields.
"false" returns actual values from the database.  If a value is not specified, this parameter defaults to false.
"all" returns both actual and display values.

parameters.name: sysparm_query
parameters.description:
Encoded query used to filter the result set. The encoded query supports order by. To sort responses based on certain fields, use the ORDERBY and ORDERBYDESC clauses in sysparm_query. For example, sysparm_query=active=true^ORDERBYnumber^ORDERBYDESCcategory filters all active records and orders the results in ascending order by number first, and then in descending order by category.

If part of the query is invalid, such as by specifying an invalid field name, the instance ignores the invalid part. It then returns rows using only the valid portion of the query. You can control this behavior using the property glide.invalid_query.returns_no_rows. Set this property to true to return no rows on an invalid query.
